comments: every little drop of knowledge is power and it counts, I love this app, along with duolingo and Asvab app, this apps are great combine. Even the singing is helping me improve my weakness academecly wise, even if is a bit annoying. I am learning things I didn't learn in highschool. ( Word problem age) needed it. I thank playstore, along with everybody involve in this project. I understand algebra and readying better. Thanks again, Make more app educational wise, plz, You got my support.

My son doesn't like that there are too many songs in this app that take too long. He says he would rather they explained the material without singing. He says he would give it half a star if he could.

Have used this on Windows 10 laptops, a Mac Computer, iPhone, iPad, Kindle Fire 7 tablet - works well on the iOS devices, but not well on the Kindle Fire 7 - I wish it did, as I love the Fire - but often the video gets out of sync with the sound.  My students love it - and I have 5 on it right now on Windows 10 laptops - no syncing problems at all.  When one logs out, there seems to be a 3 or 4 or 5 minute delay before that student can log in again, to the same account.  A bit of a problem when the Kindle would log me out for some unknown reason a bunch of times.  We did get through all the lessons on the Fire and only found one that didn't work -  and we get to try this for free for another year.  A great step in the right direction for apps for adult literacy.  Wish that it worked on the inexpensive FIre 7.  I will purchase a Fire 8 and see if the increased memory solves the syncing and logging out issues.
I was forced to use this app but its not a good one, there's songs before the lessons that go on forever and you can't skip, don't get this app, its not worth it

I love this Learning Upgrade app it is excellent practice for my Students! We love the songs, they really help them to retain their times table vocabulary etc it's a real fun way to learn awesome keep up the good work!!!

title: Sensory Baby Toddler Learning
description:
Entertain your baby or toddler in this fun, visually stimulating underwater sensory learning app. Also a great way to help develop your child‚Äôs hand to eye coordination skills, as well as for the development of children with learning disabilities such as autism.
  
Sensory Play Features: 
‚Ä¢ Vibration on touching the game screen
‚Ä¢ Sound Effects on touching the game screen 
‚Ä¢ Choose from multiple effects that are created where ever the game screen is touched (bubbles, starfish, fireworks)
‚Ä¢ Choose between a selection of backgrounds
‚Ä¢ Choose from a selection of scenes (reef, shipwreck etc)
‚Ä¢ Control where the fish swim to, includes multi touch support
‚Ä¢ Gyro support - as your device is rotated, the game world rotates with it
‚Ä¢ Game screen lock ‚Äì prevention from accidentally exiting the game (uses screen pinning)
‚Ä¢ Different fish to choose from, all with varying contrasting colors, you can also choose multiple fish types to play with at the same time. Now including seahorses and turtles!

Whether it be a newborn baby, infant, or child. This sensory play activity is guaranteed to provide them with joy and entertainment! Ideal for when you‚Äôre out and about and your infant is getting bored or upset, when your toddler won‚Äôt settle and getting up to mischief or when you just want to relax your kids before bed time ‚Äì distract and get their attention with some visual stimulation in a joyful way!

This sensorial app has many unique features in comparison with other sensory based games, such as the firework, bubble, balloon pop and finger paint games available. Choose to amuse your baby with this visually stimulating, interactive, sensory game.

Not only will this sensory app delight your kids, it will also provide increased educational benefits. From the early stages of your babies development, they are constantly learning and absorbing information around them, they begin to see, touch, feel, hear and understand how their interactions are affecting the environment around them. Your baby will begin to learn that touching the screen will cause bubbles to be created. Your child can drag your finger across the screen to create a pattern of bubbles. Your newborn can place their hands on the screen to cause lots of bubbles to be created at all points on the screen that they are touching. 

With sensory fish, your child will experience and educate themselves by use of the cause and effect techniques and features implemented. As your baby touches the screen, they gain instant feedback of a vibration, sound effects and bubbles. They will eventually begin to understand that their touch is also causing the fish to swim towards where they touched. If they were to touch the screen in multiple position, the fish will swim between all of those touched positions! Your baby learns and adapts to their findings within the game. 

As the game is fairly simple to understand and not too complex, it is ideal for young kids, boys and girls of ages from 0 months (with a parent showing them the game), up to the late kindergarten / preschool stage of their development where they fully understand and can control all aspects of the world and have learned exactly what the cause will be from their actions.

Sensory game play is great for the continued development of your kids motor skills and hand eye coordination development. It aids in helping to fine tune the motoric skills and movements, the very detailed movements that we require and use every day.

It has also been shown to have great benefits in learning and stimulation for children with autism and children with special educational needs (SEN). Having already received excellent feedback from parents who have children with autism, special educational needs (SEN) and learning disabilities. 

Install now! It‚Äôs convenient, educational, stimulating, fun and best of all, it‚Äôs free!

title: Spell & Pronounce words right - Spell Checker App
description:
Spell and Pronounce 

Spell and pronounce is a unique and peculiar mobile phone application which helps to spell and pronounce words accurately with an easy method. This application spell and pronounce will help those users who face difficulties while remembering spellings and do not know how to pronounce a correct word.

The basic concept of this application spells and pronounces is to convert voice to text which in response will show before you the right spellings.

Most of time in our daily life, when we are in haste, we do not want to write a single word. For this situation, you need not to worry. You just click the button, pronounce a word, and you will get your word with spellings in this application spell and pronounce.
On the other hand, sometimes, you do not want to spell a word. Don‚Äôt be panic in such circumstances. You write your word in this application spell and pronounce. You will hear the pronunciation of that word.

In spell and pronounce application we have not confined to single language‚Äôs spells and pronunciation of words or sentences, rather we have included main languages like English, German, French and Chinese. Hence, you can say that this application can be viable, practical and can be helpful worldwide. 

Features

‚û¢	In this spectacular mobile phone application, one of the main features is to check your spellings. You go into the spell option and click the mic button and speak your sentence or word. The application will show the accurate spell of your desired word or sentence. If you want to share it with your friends, there is no need to go to the other icon, you copy it and share with your beloved once. Delete option is available on the same leaf if you want to avail it.

‚û¢ The other main feature of spell and pronounce is the pronunciation of the words or sentences. Go to the label pronounce and write your required word or sentence. Click on the speaker. It will pronounce what you will write on the page. You need not to go to the other leaf, Copy, paste, delete, share and mic option has been developed on the same page.

‚û¢ One of the wonderful features of spell and pronounce is that the app will even correct your wrong pronunciation.

‚û¢ One more beautiful feature is that if you want spellings in slow motion, it will spell alphabets one by one.

‚û¢ Spell and pronounce is a user friendly app and quick to response. No delay in giving response.

Download this beautiful application and share with your friends too. We need your feedback to improve our work. Thanks.

title: Learning Ally Audiobooks
description:
This app provides access to Learning Ally‚Äôs library of human-read audiobooks, offering an extensive selection of books students want and need to read, including bestsellers, classic literature and textbooks. Now students have interactive learning tools geared to help them succeed, including highlighted text synced with the audio narration, speed control, bookmarking, highlighting, and note taking.


Learning Ally membership is required to use this app. Learning Ally is for students with dyslexia or other reading deficits who struggle with decoding, fluency or comprehension, who are blind or visually impaired, or who have a physical disability that prohibits them from reading standard print.

If you need help getting started with the Learning Ally Audiobook App, please call our Customer Care team at 800-221-4792 or Contact Us.

summary: Learning Ally is an educational app designed for learning through listening
recentChanges: Thank you for using Learning Ally Audiobooks! This update delivers a new collection of grade-appropriate recommended audiobooks to your experience!
comments: I'm in the middle of a book series called Stalking Jack the Ripper,but the app cuts the series short, (even young adults like to read too) if the app wasn't vital, I'd look so where else to read. I also can't stand when I'm listening to an audiotext and the voice changes midway through, so ic really prefer to stay with the current narrator. P.S. if you want better ratings try uploading books like the Stalking Jack the Ripper series for older dyslexia readers.

The service is vital but the app itself is terrible. It's definitely something that if I didn't *need* it so bad I wouldn't use it *because* of the app. The app is glitchy and rereads the same pages over and over, shut off at random times, the pages must be manually turned much of the time or it gets sick/goes back to the page you started on at random intervals (too bad if you didn't know your pg #), it shuts off w/ the screen, and there's no option to control the playback from the lock screen.
Whenever I'm listening to a story and my phone screen times out, it will either reread a section that was pages away or it will just abruptly stop.
Audio playback is buggy. Audio skips back randomly making it frustrating to listen to.
This is a great app and I really recommend it. It has EVERYTHING you need to have a good time reading

title: Spelling 3rd Grade - Learn & Practice
description:
Do you want to make learning 3rd grade spelling skills faster and easier than ever before? Then get this app.

Spelling 3rd Grade by Class Ace helps kids learn hundreds of the most common 3rd grade words all on their own. The app features 75 ex-Google Product Manager designed step-by-step lessons. Parents and teachers, that means more free time for you.

Here's how it works: 

1. Ask your students to earn a few medals in the app every school day.
2. Students earn medals by learning from 'read-along' articles and completing adaptive practice questions.
3. You review their progress from the Teacher View. The app makes it easy.

Watch your child's grades improve with just a few minutes of regular practice.

The content is so simple and the technology is so effective that even kids with learning disabilities and difficulties decoding text can learn on their own.

Features:

‚Ä¢ 75 simple ‚Äòread-long‚Äô lessons teach more quickly than lectures and videos alone.
‚Ä¢ Effective, adaptive practice. Each student sees a different set of questions that get harder over time. When they make mistakes, the questions change in real-time to maximize learning and minimize frustration, following the ‚Äòspaced repetition‚Äô learning theory.
‚Ä¢ Text to speech. Tap on any word to have it read out loud. 
‚Ä¢ Auto-play. Sit back and enjoy the whole lesson read to you. Even kids with difficulties decoding text or paying attention can learn spelling skills on their own.
‚Ä¢ Switch between up to 10 password-protected student profiles.
‚Ä¢ Teacher View: Keep kids accountable for regular practice with minimal effort. Look at charts of useful metrics. See where students are struggling, and jump in to help. 
‚Ä¢ Gamification. Medals, progress bars, and uplifting interfaces motivate students to do their best.

Spelling 3rd Grade is a collective effort of veteran teachers, technologists, and student testers working over the last 2 years. The app is designed by an ex-Google Product Manager to maximize learning and retention.

=======

Spelling 3rd Grade is a member of the Class Ace family of apps. One subscription unlocks full access to over 1,000+ Class Ace lessons across 15+ apps covering K-6 subjects.

Subscription Info:

‚Ä¢ Unlimited access to all Class Ace lessons and all apps covering K-6 Common Core standards starts at $6.99 per month after a 1 week free trial.
‚Ä¢ Subscriptions come with 3 student profiles. Each additional student is $2 per month. One account can hold up to 10 student profiles. For larger accounts, visit Class Ace on the web.
‚Ä¢ Cancel Anytime: You won't be charged if you cancel before the end of the trial period.
‚Ä¢ Renewal: Auto-renewal may be turned off anytime from Account Settings.

Subscriptions automatically renew unless they are turned off at least 24 hours before the end of the current period in account settings. Renewals are charged within 24-hours preceding the end of the current period. Payment is charged to your Google Play Account at confirmation of purchase. Subscriptions are managed by the user. Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to Spelling 3rd Grade by Class Ace, where applicable.

You can access Spelling 3rd Grade without a subscription, but will be limited to 20 free questions per day.

No parent wants to see their child fall behind. Yet over 50% of 4th graders weren't proficient in 4th grade common core standards in the US in 2017. That's why we made Spelling 3rd Grade. We're making learning faster and easier than ever before.

=======

Help & Support

Problems, questions, or want to get in touch?
Contact us at support@classace.io

Links:

Terms of Service: https://classace.io/terms
Privacy: https://classace.io/privacy

Spelling 3rd Grade is a member of the Class Ace family of apps. One subscription unlocks full access to over 1,000+ Class Ace lessons across 15+ apps covering K-6 subjects.

Subscription Info:

‚Ä¢ Unlimited access to all Class Ace lessons and all apps covering K-6 Common Core standards starts at $6.99 per month after a 1 week free trial.
‚Ä¢ Subscriptions come with 3 student profiles. Each additional student is $2 per month. One account can hold up to 10 student profiles. For larger accounts, visit Class Ace on the web.
‚Ä¢ Cancel Anytime: You won't be charged if you cancel before the end of the trial period.
‚Ä¢ Renewal: Auto-renewal may be turned off anytime from Account Settings.

Subscriptions automatically renew unless they are turned off at least 24 hours before the end of the current period in account settings. Renewals are charged within 24-hours preceding the end of the current period. Payment is charged to your Google Play Account at confirmation of purchase. Subscriptions are managed by the user. Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to Spelling 3rd Grade by Class Ace, where applicable.

You can access Spelling 3rd Grade without a subscription, but will be limited to 20 free questions per day.

No parent wants to see their child fall behind. Yet over 50% of 4th graders weren't proficient in 4th grade common core standards in the US in 2017. That's why we made Spelling 3rd Grade. We're making learning faster and easier than ever before.

=======

Help & Support

Problems, questions, or want to get in touch?
Contact us at support@classace.io

Terms of Service: https://classace.io/terms
Privacy: https://classace.io/privacy

title: Letter Puzzle: Learn To Read
description:
Includes: English, German, French, Spanish, Hindi, Chinese, Russian, Indonesian, Italian, Turkish, Polish, Danish, Swedish, Bulgarian, Catalan, Georgian, Slovak, Czech, Hungarian, Greek, Romanian

Can learning to read be as easy and exciting as playing a computer game? We've developed a game with which you can learn to read intuitively and individually, as you would play a game.
We believe that a learning game has to be so good that it would encourage you to play it even though you might not be interested in its pedagogical content. We've done our best to implement this idea in our game. In doing so, we incorporate psycho-pedagogical foundations and concepts from the Montessori method, improve upon such tools as phonetic charts and present the syllables as they are actually spoken and not as they would be if spoken separately. Our emphasis is not on learning to recite the alphabet or spelling out words; on the contrary, instead of learning the ABC off by heart, the pupil learns which sounds actually occur in each word. As such, double vowels, for instance, are never separated.

Should you have any further questions about our pedagogical method or about the game itself, please feel free to contact us at: info@regentropfen.org 

The game is adapted for children aged 4 to 8, regardless of whether the pupil goes to school, kindergarten, pre-school or primary school. Children in higher grade may also profit from the game in case of various reading and/or spelling difficulties such as dyslexia. You can also use the game to learn some basics of foreign languages, regardless of your age: thanks to the audio clips, you can discover learn the pronunciation of the individual phonemes in each word. You hence not only learn a translation of the word, but have a native speaker show you the meaning and the spelling of each word. Of course, this is not meant to be a complete linguistic pedagogical environment: the words offered are all nouns and there are as of yet no adjectives, verbs and no punctuation. Learning the language is based here on a challenging speaking vocabulary trainer. This app however can be used as an interactive introduction to the acquisition of speaking skills for individual words. The game does not contain a dictionary and is not split up in individual lessons, but rather in levels with various themes such as pirates, animals or vehicles.

title: Supersense - helps blind and visually impaired
description:
Supersense is the smartest assistive app that helps blind and visually impaired users to read, find objects, and explore places independently. It provides a set of digital eyes to make the physical world more accessible for the blind and low vision community. 

Supersense uses the power of AI to not only describe things but actually solve problems for blind and visually impaired users. Users can independently:
- Read texts, documents and handwriting quickly using our unique auto camera guidance system
- Locate specific objects such as a chair, door, trashcan, or person around by scanning the environment with the camera
- Explore new and unfamiliar environments and hear about the objects that are around
- Read texts on photos and PDFs from other apps. Simply share the files to Supersense and it will read it for you in seconds.

Every single feature works without an internet connection so that they can be used in any situation.

The app has full TalkBack accessibility support and is available in multiple languages.

Supersense is developed by Mediate, an MIT-spinoff AI start-up based in Boston. Mediate develops innovative computer vision systems with the support of the National Science Foundation and the US Department of Veterans Affairs. This app is just the first step in our mission to develop groundbreaking AI solutions for people with visual disabilities. We have developed the app with principles of human-centered design and with the assistance of blind and visually impaired users. We also partnered with many organizations that help the blind and low vision community.

If you would like any assistance or help, please email us at feedback@mediate.tech. We always love to hear ideas and feedback from the blind and visually impaired community.

title: Speech Assistant AAC
description:
Speech Assistant AAC is a Text to Speech (TTS) app designed for people who are speech impaired, for example due to Aphasia, MND/ALS, Autism, Stroke, Cerebral Palsy or other speech problems.

With the app you can create categories and phrases, which are placed on buttons. With these buttons you can create messages that can be shown or spoken (text-to-speech). It is also possible to type any text using the keyboard.
The app is easy to use and can be completely customized to your needs and preferences.

For all devices
‚Ä¢ The app is available for smartphones and tablets.
‚Ä¢ Portrait and landscape layout for all devices.

Categories and phrases
‚Ä¢ Add, change or delete your own phrases. 
‚Ä¢ You can create categories to organize your phrases for quick access.
‚Ä¢ Long press (optional setting) to easily edit the phrase and category buttons.
‚Ä¢ Option to Backup and Restore your categories and phrases.

Fully Customizable
‚Ä¢ The size of the buttons, the textbox and the text can be adjusted.
‚Ä¢ The app has various color schemes and you can also create a personal color scheme.

Full screen
‚Ä¢ Show your message full screen with a very large font.
‚Ä¢ Useful for communicating in a noisy environment.

Other features
‚Ä¢ Connect a bluetooth keyboard and create shortcuts for the functions Speak, Clear and Show.
‚Ä¢ Button to share your message to mail, text and social media.
‚Ä¢ Option for preventing double tapping by disabling the button (for a short time) after touching.
‚Ä¢ Undo option in case of unintentionally tapping the clear button.
‚Ä¢ Button to make an attention sound.
   
Speech
The voice is not part of the app, but the app uses the voice that‚Äôs installed on your device. For instance the voices from Google Text-to-Speech. You can change the voice in the settings of your device. You can also download other voices from the Google Play Store.
   
Feedback and information
For feedback, questions, tips or problems, please contact: android@asoft.nl
Website: www.asoft.nl
   
Full version
In the settings of the app you can upgrade to the full version with additional features like more categories and phrases, customizable action buttons, pronunciation corrections and much more.

comments: Found it outstanding, I have mnd and my voice has gone and and I am a techno phobe and found this easy to use, communication between me and my wife is far better now. This app is far superior to others I have tried.

This app is everything I never realized I needed!!! I am on the Autism spectrum, and my wife is too. We both go nonverbal sometimes. This makes it so much easier to communicate during those times. Wish I had this growing up!!! It's also fun to play with because we are immature lol. We made the male Google voice sound uncannily like Connor from Detroit: Become Human.
This thing has saved my butt when anxiety shuts down my ability to talk. It's easy to modify, and it doesn't feel like an AAC device for special needs, with extraneous pictures. Simple, easy to use.

Great app! It's very customizable and perfect for those who prefer text-based AAC apps. I even have different profiles with different setups and colors for my ease of use. This is simply great and flexible.
i love this. i have autism and sometimes go nonverbal in stressful situations, i love that i was able to program the phrases to be exactly what i want.

title: Percival's Help For Dyslexia
description:
Percival‚Äôs Help For Dyslexia - Say goodbye to pepul, cud and sevun!

Has your child been diagnosed with dyslexia? Are they struggling to learn the spellings they are set by their school? Are you looking for a way to help them that you can enjoy together? Why not try Percival‚Äôs Help For Dyslexia? Suddenly, "nite" becomes Night Is Good Howling Time and "sevun" becomes Seven Evil Vampires Eat Nuggets!

Percival‚Äôs Help For Dyslexia, also known as Percival's Essential Spellings, has been specifically designed to help children who have dyslexia. This includes the ability to alter the colour of the screen and wording to suit their needs for colour contrasts, caused by the often linked condition of "visual stress". 

The Professor focuses on 107 common words that you can‚Äôt make with letter sounds, but which are commonly used in everyday life, such as days of the week, colours, months of the year, connectives, pronouns etc. He gives your child ways to remember these tricky words including: 

Mnemonics
Chants
Animations
Hand and body movements 

Plus, the Professor has packed in loads of colourful cartoons that will stick in your child‚Äôs mind.  There are also the hilarious ‚Äúfridge safety tips‚Äù‚Ä¶  You never know what is lurking and pulling the strange man in!

Developed by a leading English primary school teacher, and outstanding Special Needs Assistant, Percival‚Äôs Help For Dyslexia is used in schools throughout the United Kingdom to teach children of all ages with spelling difficulties. It is ideal for children who are finding the traditional "look, cover, write, check" and "synthetic phonics" approaches that are used in schools ineffective. 

Ultimately, Percival‚Äôs Help For Dyslexia is a fun activity where you can work with your child to help them learn the spellings they are going to need throughout their lives. It is bound to appeal to your child and will make the learning of spellings more interesting and entertaining.

LEARN MORE: https://www.keystoneeducation.co.uk/parents/

title: KNFB Reader
description:
The KNFB Reader app is an essential tool for anyone with low vision, visual impairments, difficulty reading, reading disabilities such as dyslexia, as well as blind individuals. 

It reads anything from menus, bills, documents, signs, mail, PDFs and JPEG files and more for immediate and easy access!

Limited Time Offer: Free Trial Download of KNFB Reader! 

This trial version includes all the features of the paid app, but is limited to twenty-five document scans. When you‚Äôre ready to purchase the full version, you‚Äôll be able to do so through an in-app purchase. 

How It Works: 
Simply take a picture of any text with your device and the app reads it aloud or displays it with a connected Braille display. The app uses high-quality speech to text and OCR for accuracy. 

The app helps you get a good photo with viewfinder assist, tilt assist, and automatic text detection.  It navigates by line, sentence, word, or character and has synchronized text highlighting. It can read multiple pages and is fully accessible using Google TalkBack.

It works in multiple languages, including, but to limited to English, Norwegian (Bokm√•l), Dutch, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, Swedish, Danish, Turkish, Russian and Polish. More details below.

KNFB Reader is the winner of the 2016 AFB Access Award. 

Users love it! How else can KNFB Reader make your life easier?

It can read receipts.  Never worry about being overcharged again.  You will know what has been put on your card at restaurants, stores, or in taxis.  

KNFB reader can read package labels.  Wonder who sent you that package? Want to know what came in the mail?  Can‚Äôt remember when you bought that lunchmeat in the fridge?  Need nutritional information from your breakfast cereal?  KNFB Reader captures it all quickly and easily. 

KNFB Reader can read price tags, clothing labels, and tags on shelves.  

KNFB Reader can capture print from your computer or tablet screen. If your screen reader is not cooperating, just photograph the screen and know exactly what those error messages say. 

KNFB Reader can read lengthy user manuals. By scanning multiple pages at a time in the batch mode you can easily learn how to operate any new device or appliance.

KNFB Reader helps you read books. Batch mode scans multiple pages and saves them so you can read them at your leisure. 

KNFB Reader has various options to adapt the font type, size and color, background color and the use of double highlighting. Visually impaired people or those with other print disabilities (such as dyslexia) can easily follow what is being read aloud on the screen by watching the cursor move across the document.

Fully localized versions (user interface, recognition and speech) are available for: English, Norwegian (Bokm√•l), Dutch, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, Swedish, Danish, Turkish, Russian and Polish.
Other languages available for only speech and recognition: Finnish, Czech, Bulgarian, Ukrainian, Estonian and Greek

Compatibility: 
‚Ä¢ Optimal experience: Android device with a hexa or octa core CPU, an eight megapixel camera, and Android 5 or 6.
‚Ä¢ Less optimal (KNFB Reader will run, but you will notice reduced speed): An Android device with a 1.2 GHz quad-core CPU, a 5 megapixel camera, and Android version 4.3.

Visit our website at: www.knfbreader.com 
Please send feedback and suggestions to: support@knfbreader.com

title: Math & Logic - Brain Games: Preschoolers to Age 10
description:
‚Ä¢ Validated by research: http://imagiration.com/research/
‚Ä¢ All arithmetic exercises are completely FREE
‚Ä¢ No ads. Math & Logic is a completely safe environment for children - there is no advertising or ability for an external party to contact your child. 
‚Ä¢ No setup or registration needed
‚Ä¢ No Wi-Fi necessary to play
‚Ä¢ Unique interface that discourages children to use trial-and-error
‚Ä¢ Scientifically proven to improve performance in children with learning disabilities: https://goo.gl/3rpLRn

ImagiRation‚Äôs free math and brain training program consists of fun and interactive puzzle games to help your child learn math and improve cognitive development. ImagiRation puzzles were designed by brain scientists and used by over 1 million children.

MATH & LOGIC OFFERS THOUSANDS OF FUN AND INTERACTIVE LEARNING ACTIVITIES:

‚Ä¢ Arithmetic
‚Ä¢ Logic
‚Ä¢ Numbers
‚Ä¢ Counting
‚Ä¢ Addition
‚Ä¢ Subtraction
‚Ä¢ Multiplication
‚Ä¢ Division
‚Ä¢ Mental Synthesis
‚Ä¢ Critical thinking 
‚Ä¢ Logical Reasoning
‚Ä¢ Impulse Control
‚Ä¢ Attention
‚Ä¢ Working Memory
‚Ä¢ Creativity

FEATURES:

‚Ä¢ Math & Logic teaches through a variety of interactive learning activities including games, animations, art activities, and puzzles ‚Äì all of which can be monitored by parents through a Progress Tracker.
‚Ä¢ Each activity is adaptive and delivers exercises that are at the exact level of difficulty appropriate for your child at any given point in time.
‚Ä¢ The selection of activities is also adaptive. New activities will be automatically selected based on your child performance. 
‚Ä¢ Simple drag-and-drop mechanism makes it easy for all children, including toddlers and preschoolers, to touch and move objects.
‚Ä¢ Structured approach to cognitive exercises, with a set number of games on a path that kids can complete every day before earning a fun reward at the end of their daily exercises.
‚Ä¢ Animated characters and Playtime rewards will keep your child engaged while learning and having fun.
‚Ä¢ Multiple Playtime themes will allow your child to choose the one that appeals to him or her most.
‚Ä¢ Clean and intuitive interface with beautiful graphics that every child will love.

FOSTER IMAGINATION AND CREATIVITY:

‚Ä¢ Learn numbers
‚Ä¢ Learn arithmetic
‚Ä¢ Learn multiplication table
‚Ä¢ Improve intelligence and IQ
‚Ä¢ Strengthen early language and cognitive development
‚Ä¢ Improve visual learning and spatial thinking
‚Ä¢ Improve fine motor skills
‚Ä¢ Enhance problem-solving and reasoning abilities 
‚Ä¢ Improve attention and concentration in children with ADHD
‚Ä¢ Develop mental-simulation skills
‚Ä¢ Prepare for kindergarten admission exams, such as Admissions Assessment for Beginning Learners (AABL) and other Kindergarten Readiness Tests (KRT)
‚Ä¢ Prepare for other standardized tests: WISC
‚Ä¢ Prepare for private school entrance screening.

THE STORY BEHIND IMAGIRATION:

ImagiRation is developed by Dr. A. Vyshedskiy, a neuroscientist from Boston University; R. Dunn, a Harvard-educated early-child-development specialist; MIT-educated, J. Elgart and a group of award-winning artists and developers working alongside experienced therapists.

Available in English, Spanish, Portuguese, Brazilian Portuguese, Russian, German, French, Canadian French, Italian, Arabic, Farsi, Korean, and Chinese.

comments: The app is one of the best apps out there but the update has not been great at all. It does not give you an option of the voice you really prefer to listen to. At the moment, it forces you listen to different unwanted voices by selecting one section. Please list the voices namely for selections if you can. For example; Brian's voice, Adam's voice, Elizabeth's voice, etc., with individually distinctive voices to be selected from.

After the update, the text-to-speech function has been over the place. Took long pauses in between sentences. Inconsistent voice between sentences. Chages pitch and sometimes voice all the the. I have been using the app for so long and this was the worst update yet. I will change it after a fix. P. S. I'm using the Google TTS

I subscribed to the wavenet text to speech but I've not been able to use it. Clicking on the play button doesn't start it. I can't load any of the voice settings either. It goes into a loop and keeps loading forever. None of the text to speech functionalities work on my device.

The updated version is somewhat better, but it still shuts off randomly. The app keeps trying to force you into a 2.99 a month deal. Wth??? Are you making the app worse so we have to purchase this addition??? Still needs improvement. The updated version in text to speech DOESN'T pronounce ANY f's in the words. Poor update needs corrected asap.

The text to speech button disappeared with the most recent update. This is sad. Used to be one of my favorite apps. Still seems to work for epubs but tts is gone for pdf. 1. Text is still copyable. 2. It was working with pdfs until the update yesterday. As i said i use the app everyday and the ability to use tts on pdf disappeared yesterday after the update. I was in ths middle of listening to a book when the update happened

title: Talk Up! Pictograms Communicator
description:
Talk Up! Communicator is an application that allows you to convert Android devices (tablets or smartphones) into a powerful assisted communication device through the use of pictograms.
It has an optimized design to have a maximum flexibility of use as in the simplicity of operation, for which it has worked under the opinion, experience and knowledge of therapists, educators and parents.
It is aimed at non-verbal children in the spectrum of Autism and for anyone who can benefit from visual communication tools, such as:
‚Ä¢ Autism spectrum disorders
‚Ä¢ Aphasia
‚Ä¢ Apraxia
‚Ä¢ Speech disorder / phonological disorder
‚Ä¢ Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis
‚Ä¢ Motor neuron disease
‚Ä¢	Cerebral palsy
‚Ä¢	Down's Syndrome
The application allows you to express different actions and create complex sentences by selecting pictograms that belong to different categories. Once the sentence is completed, the system will proceed to read the phrase formed word by word or as a whole.
It is provided with a set of basic pictograms that allow 100% operational use of the application from the start.

Characteristics:
‚Ä¢ Augmentative and Alternative Communication Systems, Augmentative and Alternative Communication
‚Ä¢ Create new categories and add your own images
pre-configured for Children with Autism 
‚Ä¢ Voice of the images in English, Spanish

If you have difficulties with the application please contact us before leaving a negative rating or comment. Our intention is to make the best effort to help. (emerging.solutions@gmail.com)

If the application has been to your liking, please take the time to provide a rating.

For more details you can check our Website https://sites.google.com/view/talk-up/home

Note: The application uses some ARASAAC pictograms (http://arasaac.org/), created by Sergio Palao and distributed under a Creative Commons license (BY-NC-SA).

comments: Paid for full version a few months ago and just stopped working. Now wont even open

Most of the critical reviews are about word choice, which I think is either a translation issue or cultural differences. You can change the wording, just read the faq! I changed "shut up" to "quiet", wash face had a typo, changed "to clean your ass" to "to wipe butt", "oilskin" to "raincoat" and "diadem" to "headband". I hope to use this with my nephew, so haven't tried it yet but I have heard good things about talking boards and this looks great! Thank you for offering a free version.

Paid for "Pro", put images in row...see no way t play. "HELP" button does nothing. Went to the instructions "?", says to hit "speaker icon" to play....no speaker icon. This app is not very intuitive. (APP installed on Android Phone)
Very useful and simple to use. Help me to communicate with my son. We are used to the Picture and Exchange Communication System and this App fits a lot.
My life is already difficult and to use an app that's just unexplainable without a tutorial is too much for me!!! Waste of time!!! If could I would rate it no stars!!! SUCKS!!!

title: Fifth Grade Learning Games
description:
18 fun and educational games to help your child learn 5th Grade lessons! Teach them advanced 5th grade topics such as fractions, algebra, science, division, grammar, geometry, language, spelling, reading, and more. Whether they are just starting Fifth Grade, or need to review and master the subjects, this is a perfect learning tool for kids aged 9-12. Math, language, science, STEM, reading, and critical thinking skills are all tested and practiced in these games.

Every lesson and activity is designed using real fifth grade curriculums, so you can be sure these games will help give your child a boost in the classroom. And with helpful voice narration and exciting games, your 5th grade student won't want to stop playing and learning! Improve your student's homework with these 5th grade teacher approved lessons, including STEM, science, language, and math.

This version comes with 2 free games unlocked for free. Get the remaining games via a simple in-app purchase.

These learning games include dozens of important lessons for Fifth Grade, including:
‚Ä¢ Fractions - Fraction Number Lines, Multiply Fractions, Numerator/Denominator
‚Ä¢ Order of Operations - Solve equations using the correct order
‚Ä¢ Measure and Volume - Time, metric conversion, and calculating volume
‚Ä¢ Exponents - Find value, convert to exponents, and scientific notation
‚Ä¢ Algebra - Solve for x using add, subtract, divide, and multiply
‚Ä¢ Multiples - Identify multiples of a number
‚Ä¢ Root Words - Learn the meaning of Greek and Latin root words
‚Ä¢ Spelling - Hundred of spelling words of varying degrees
‚Ä¢ Sentence Types - Run-on, incomplete, and a variety of other sentence types
‚Ä¢ Reading - Read articles and answer questions to improve reading comprehension
‚Ä¢ Multiple Meanings - Use context to find the correct word
‚Ä¢ Pronouns - Learn about different types of pronouns
‚Ä¢ Cells - Identify cell parts and learn their functions
‚Ä¢ Latitude & Longitude - Find treasure while learning about latitude and longitude coordinates
‚Ä¢ Scientific Method - Discover the Scientific Method and how scientists use it
‚Ä¢ Friction - Learn about the types of friction in this fun science game
‚Ä¢ Color Spectrum - Identify different parts of the electromagnetic spectrum
‚Ä¢ Gravity - Test gravity on different planets and learn how gravity impacts us on Earth

Perfect for 5th grade kids and students who need a fun and entertaining educational game to play. This bundle of games helps your child learn important math, language, algebra, science, and STEM skills used in fifth grade all while having fun! 5th Grade teachers around the world use this app with their students to help reinforce math, language, and science subjects.

Ages: 9, 10, 11, and 12 year old children and students.

=====================================

PROBLEMS WITH THE GAME? 
If you are having any issues please email us at help@rosimosi.com and we will get it fixed for you ASAP.

LEAVE US A REVIEW!
If you're enjoying the game then we'd love for you to leave us a review! Reviews help small developers like us to keep improving the game.

title: Early Reading Skills Builder Lite
description:
Note: This is the Free version of ERSB. Level 1 with 5 lessons is Free! The rest of the levels are available through the in-app store.

Early Reading Skills Builder‚Ñ¢(ERSB) curriculum, based on a multi-year research project from the University of North Carolina at Charlotte, is a stepping stone for graduates of Attainment‚Äôs ELSB Curriculum. 

ERSB takes students who mastered these early literacy skills to a 2nd grade reading level. It incorporates systematic instruction and ongoing assessments to teach students to read independently. It‚Äôs been proven effective for students with moderate to severe intellectual disability and/or autism, including those with complex communication needs.

title: Advantage4Kids
description:
Welcome to the Advantage4Kids App, a math and reading component of the Southwestern Advantage Learning System.  Advantage4Kids provides engaging instruction and practice in math and reading for 2nd‚Äì6th graders via hundreds of tutorial videos, comprehension quizzes, animated glossary terms, educational games, and over 100 National Geographic Kids eBooks.  A host of kid-friendly animated characters, like Gem, Sorsha, X, and Prof Wu‚Äîalong with the help of some very talented educators‚Äîguarantee that kids will have fun understanding today‚Äôs math and reading requirements!  

What‚Äôs Included:
*More than 400 tutorial videos providing instruction on math topics like place values, fractions, algebra, and integers and reading topics like grammar, reading strategies, spelling, and reading comprehension.

title: NaturalReader Text to Speech
description:
NaturalReader is text to speech app that reads text, PDF, webpages, and eBooks aloud to you with our quality, natural-sounding voices.

NaturalReader is an essential tool for those with dyslexia and other reading difficulties. Open up your ears to a new reading experience with over 50 voices in over 20 languages. Just sit back, relax, and let us read to you.

Are you a student bogged down by a long reading list? Use NaturalReader to upload your e-textbooks, eBooks, or class notes to ease the burden and rest your eyes. Listen and review on the go while commuting to class or multitasking at home. Bookmark important pages for easy access later on. For both students and writers alike, NaturalReader is also an efficient proofreading tool.

NaturalReader is a great app for all kinds of readers. Adjust the speaker's speed and background color to suit your own preferences. Use it to multitask and enjoy listening on the go while running, commuting, or any household tasks.

Open up any email attachments with NaturalReader to get your important documents to read to you instantly. You can also connect to your Dropbox, OneDrive, or Google Drive account to easily access and listen to your files from your device. Keep up with your favorite webpages with our built-in browser.

To improve your reading experience, we have added a new Pronunciation Editor. Use this feature to fine-tune the pronunciation of new or unusual words, or to improve the readability of acronyms.

No matter what kind of reader you are, experience more with NaturalReader.

Note: DRM-protected eBooks from iBooks, Kindle, Nook, or Adobe OverDrive cannot be opened with NaturalReader

comments: Good apps with lots of "premium voice" and great looking ui. But the cons is: 1. They don't support web reading unlike @Voice. 2. If you using pdf better use moon reader, they have simplified mode and night mode also they bookmark your pdf or book folder (no sign up) and of course they can use text to speech as well. 3. They don't have search feature or favourite for the voice so good luck searching it. The pros probably 1. They can use cloud, 2. They can use ocr (paid). 3. Lots of voice (paid)

Love the app. It's really good for slow readers like me. Can you guys please add folders for adding custom books you own so you can read them? I also love the CC feature as well. I have bad reading comprehension and a intellectual learning disability so I have a hard time learning. It's really hard trying to find a app like this. It's a good app if anyone has a learning disability who struggles. If I take a picture of a Japanese light novel book in English that I bought will ORC pick it up?

I bought NR several years ago. Its been the best program i found up until last year. It got very glitchy. Today i had a problem with it playing my document at all even after i restarted the app. I uninstalled and reinstalled only to find out the entire app was updated and now is a monthly subscription. Im not where i can afford that atm and Im a sad that I didnt realise it before i uninstalled. I prefer one time pymnts. The new version says there is a free version but it wont work on my phone.
This app has potential however it cannot read hyphenated words such as self-employed instead it reads "self minus employed." As I have lots of readings with hyphenated words this becomes problematic.
100 percent functional. Love it. Will be 6sing forever.

title: Card Talk
description:
Card Talk supports communication with cards for children who have difficulties in verbal communication.
You can indicate your emotion/intention, and learn vocabularies and grammar at the same time.

This app was developed from the actual cards used in LITALICO classrooms. 
Now everybody can use these special cards to learn communication anywhere, at anytime.
The app has been improved over and over based on the feedbacks from classrooms.

  *LITALICO classrooms are run by teachers and professors who specialize in kids development and education. 

Characteristics of this app: 

‚Ä¢¬†All 200 cards for everyday use include voice sound. 
‚Ä¢¬†The app supports multiple languages so you can switch to whichever language you want to learn.
‚Ä¢¬†You can make your original card with original picture and recording.
‚Ä¢¬†Choices of cards may be limited so it also fits in initial learning.
‚Ä¢¬†NO Advertisements are displayed so there is no visual destruction and kids can use it safely.


Please feel free to notify us!
app-support@litalico.co.jp

Hope you enjoy our app.
Thank you!

comments: This would have been a great app with just the provided cards, but the option to create your own cards makes it amazing! I use this to show my child a short-term schedule and being able to customize and change on the fly is invaluable.
Well described picture and easy to use

It would be nice if choice menu was on top rather than bottom of the screen as cell phone controls like "back screen", "close window", and "go to windows opened" are all at the bottom of a cell phone. Also having the option to change voice to male would be nice. And include more articals in options. Otherwise, this a very nice app and easly to use by my Down's Syndrome son. Thank you!

This is nothing short of AMAZING!!!! Almost every assistant talking device is expensive and this app is free!!! To be able to communicate with my 2 year old daughter who has autism and limited speech is priceless!!! Thank you sooooo much with all my heart for this app.

My 13 yr old is nonverbal, i wanted to find a free app to support our time together being less frustrating - this app is amazing. Lots of basic cards, easy for him to navigate, and we are currently making custom cards for the unique places/people/activities in our lives. 5 stars.

title: Phonograms
description:
Welcome to The Spalding Method‚Ñ¢  Phonograms app!

NOTICE: UPON INSTALLING THIS MOBILE APPLICATION, YOU ARE AGREEING TO THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.

This Spalding Phonograms app is designed for helping students learn the phonics connection between speech sounds and written symbols that represent those sounds (phonograms). Learning the phonograms is essential for accurate and automatic reading, writing, and spelling. Teaching all the sounds of the phonemes represented by an alphabet letter or combination of two, three, or four letters (phonograms) enables students to read, spell, and write high-frequency words quickly. Students who learn the phonograms well expand their vocabulary and are able to use effective and creative communication skills in writing. Critical thinking is involved in learning the appropriate phonogram placement within words for accurate spelling and for applying information learned during phonogram reviews to pronounce unfamiliar words. 

The Spalding Phonograms app is for students that need additional practice, including home schooling, ESL (English as a Second Language), ELL (English Language Learners), ESOL (English for Speakers of Other Languages) students, and those with dyslexia or other learning disabilities. The school and home connection is encouraged through collaboration and communication with the teacher, parent, and student for practicing the phonograms appropriately and adequately. The Spalding  Phonograms app aligns with the core reading foundational skills required by state and national standards that are most crucial to the development of early reading success and reading comprehension, including:

  ‚Ä¢	Phonemic awareness
  ‚Ä¢	Feature recognition
  ‚Ä¢	Letter recognition
  ‚Ä¢	Sound-symbol relationships (decoding)

The Spalding Phonograms app provides the following options for all 87 phonograms.

  ‚Ä¢	Phonogram Introduction by selected group ‚Äì The student sees the phonograms in order of instruction in "The Writing Road to Reading," listens to the teacher say the sound(s), and then says the sound(s).
  ‚Ä¢	Oral Phonogram Review ‚Äì A random phonogram card is show, followed by a pause. The student says the sound(s) and then listens to check accuracy. 
  ‚Ä¢	Written Phonogram Review ‚ÄìThe student hears the phonogram sounds, followed by a pause; the student repeats the sound(s), listens for a cue, if needed, and then writes the phonogram on lined paper. The card is immediately shown so the student can check for accuracy.
  ‚Ä¢	Differentiated Practice ‚Äì Specific phonograms (from all 87) can be selected that need more practice. These phonograms can then be practiced in Phonogram Introduction, Oral Phonogram Review, or Written Phonogram Review.

comments: Can't say enough bad things about this app. Totally useless for practicing the phonics and helping a parent at home. You Can't even finish one set of phonics and it stops making the sound or repeating...

Very disappointed that this app stops doing the audio portion aloud after about 15 phonograms. There must be some kind of bug on the android version. I have to back all the way out and restart the app in order for it to play the sounds again. It has been the same problem ever since we started using it 3 weeks ago. Very frustrating. Please fix bug. When it does work, it is good and it is nice to be able to hear the sounds. I regret I paid for this.
App doesn't work consistently. Very dissatisfied with how often I have to reset the app.

Works great on my android phone, absolutely useless on my sons fire tablet. Gets stuck a few letters into practice and won't make any sounds. Restarting the app doesn't help either. Pretty annoyed I had to purchase it on 2 devices just to get one that works.

I was hoping to use this app for a class and as a practice tool. But after downloading it, it has not worked. There is no sound. The whole point of this app is to help with phonogram sounds. I would not recommend this app.

title: Sixth Grade Learning Games
description:
Learn important 6th Grade lessons with these 18 fun and interactive games! Teach them advanced 6th grade topics such as statistics, algebra, biology, science, geometry, rounding, language, vocabulary, reading, and more. Whether they are just starting Sixth Grade, or need to review and master the subjects, this is a perfect learning tool for kids aged 10-13. Math, language, science, STEM, reading, and critical thinking skills are all tested and practiced in these games.

Every lesson and activity is designed using real sixth grade curriculums, so you can be sure these games will help give your child a boost in the classroom. And with helpful voice narration and exciting games, your 6th grade student will want to keep playing and learning! Improve your student's homework with these 6th grade teacher approved lessons, including STEM, science, language, and math.

This version includes 2 games provided for free, you may unlock all 18 through a simple in-app purchase.

These learning games include dozens of important lessons for sixth grade, including:
‚Ä¢ Number Sense/Theory - Absolute Value, Roman Numerals, Number Lines, and More 
‚Ä¢ Probability and Stats - Median, Mode, Range, and Probability 
‚Ä¢ Geometry - Congruency, Symmetry, Angle Types, and Area
‚Ä¢ Consumer Math - Learn about sales, tax, tips, and other ways to calculate money 
‚Ä¢ Algebra - Use the distributive property, evaluate expressions, and solve for x 
‚Ä¢ Rounding - Round numbers to the nearest whole number, tenth, and hundredth
‚Ä¢ Synonyms and Antonyms - Identify different words that mean the same or opposite
‚Ä¢ Vocabulary - Learn the definitions of challenging words 
‚Ä¢ Spelling - Hundreds of spelling words of varying difficulty 
‚Ä¢ Reading Comprehension - Reading articles and then answer questions 
‚Ä¢ Word Memory - Use clues to match words 
‚Ä¢ Subject Verb Agreement - Pop balloons with verbs that match the subject
‚Ä¢ Laws of Motion - Use Newton's Laws of Motion in various experiments
‚Ä¢ Periodic Table - Learn about all the elements and how to use the periodic table
‚Ä¢ Biology - Advanced life science topics such as biology, evolution, and animal classifications
‚Ä¢ Atoms - Learn about the building block of everything
‚Ä¢ Circuits - Build and explore electric circuits
‚Ä¢ Space Exploration - Discover all the ways we explore our solar system and outer space


Perfect for 6th grade kids and students who need a fun and entertaining educational game to play. This bundle of games helps your child learn important math, language, algebra, science, and STEM skills used in sixth grade all while having fun! 6th Grade teachers around the world use this app with their students to help reinforce math, language, and science subjects.

Ages: 10, 11, 12, and 13 year old children and students.

=====================================

PROBLEMS WITH THE GAME? 
If you are having any issues please email us at help@rosimosi.com and we will get it fixed for you ASAP.

LEAVE US A REVIEW!
If you're enjoying the game then we'd love for you to leave us a review! Reviews help small developers like us to keep improving the game.

title: Learn to Read & Save Animals, English Phonics ABC
description:
‚ÄúLearn to Read & Save the Animals‚Äù ‚Äì is an educational Montessori game for kids created for preschoolers from 4 to 7 years old and junior school children of the 1st, 2nd and 3rd grades, who learn English. It can be used for pre-school education and teaching how to read in English in kindergarten.

The evil Snow Queen has frozen the letters of the English alphabet and the poor animals were taken into the icy captivity. Only your smart kid can save the animals. In order to do that your child has to learn English letters and combine them into words, which represent the names of the captured animals. 

It‚Äôs not a big secret that many kids can face difficulties learning to read in English, because English letters in real words have different pronunciation rules in comparison with their sounds in the English alphabet. 

‚ÄúLearn to Read & Save the Animals‚Äù educational game offers efficient Phonics techniques in order to learn how to read in English. During the process of playing the educational game the children will hear the sound of each English letter in exactly the same way as it‚Äôs pronounced in the shown word. 

It allows your child to understand the rules of English word reading on the subconscious level. Kid will simply feel how to pronounce the English words, without suffering and trying to find the transcription of the word in thick English dictionaries.

WHAT YOUR CHILD WILL LEARN
‚Ä¢ We are not going to learn the English alphabet; we will teach your kids how to read in English!
‚Ä¢ Learn English ABC letters easily
‚Ä¢ Discover the names of the animals in English
‚Ä¢ Kid will learn how to read in English, reinforcing newly obtained reading skills during enthralling guessing games and quizzes 
‚Ä¢ Educational Montessori game for kids of 3 years old and higher
‚Ä¢ Pre-school education, learning how to read in English using highly efficient Phonics

Learning game for preschoolers, as well as of pupils who learn English for the students of the 1st, the 2nd and the 3rd grades or even of kindergarten kids. The interface of educational Montessori game is so simple that even a 3 year old kid can play and learn how to read English by themselves!

‚ÄúLearn to Read & Save the Animals‚Äù game offers 3 educational levels free of charge. The full version contains the total of 16 educational levels allocated by the level of complexity. Words of the very first level contain just 2 or letters, while the words of the last level may have up to 7 or even 8 letters.
descriptionHTML:

It can be used for pre-school education and teaching how to read in English in kindergarten.

The evil Snow Queen has frozen the letters of the English alphabet and the poor animals were taken into the icy captivity. Only your smart kid can save the animals. In order to do that your child has to learn English letters and combine them into words, which represent the names of the captured animals.

title: Blending Sounds 1 Pro
description:
Blending Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro is a revolutionary phonics teaching tool which helps beginning readers to use letter sounds to read first words. The program is based on research into reading acquisition and was developed by Dr. Bartek Rajkowski, PhD, a speech-language pathologist specialising in reading development. Anybody with an interest in teaching children to read can use Blending Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro to help students learn basic decoding skills!

PLEASE NOTE:
- This app is Australian! US and UK accents coming in the next update
- Blending Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro is not just a game - it is a powerful and fully customisable teaching tool. Please take some time to experiment with it yourself before trying it with students 


Why is the ability to blend (join) speech sounds when reading so important?


Skilled readers are good at understanding that words are made up of speech sounds (a skill called phonemic awareness) and they are also good at understanding how these speech sounds are represented by letters. This knowledge helps children to ‚Äòdecode‚Äô unfamiliar words by blending (joining) the speech sounds to recognise the word. Difficulties with these skills are a hallmark of the struggling reader. Furthermore, teaching methods that begin by teaching students letter-sound relationships (called ‚Äòsynthetic phonics‚Äô methods) have been shown through research to be more effective than other approaches in teaching reading, regardless of whether students do or do not have reading difficulties. The evidence from the past several decades of reading research is clear: using letter-sound knowledge to decode unfamiliar words is crucial in learning to read, since it helps students to teach themselves new words. 


How does Blending Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro help?


Blending Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro uses a patent pending, self-adjusting, multisensory teaching method to help teach beginning and struggling readers to use letter-sound knowledge to decode and recognise simple words with direct letter-sound patterns, such as "cat, stop" and "lost". The teaching system automatically identifies what a child knows, what the child does not know, and which words the child confuses. The app includes a large library of CVC, CCVC and CVCC words and is fully customisable, making it easy to set up custom activities to teach students to read specific word types (such as words ending in -at, or words beginning with st-). 


Who should use Blending Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro?


Blending Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro is ideal for helping beginning readers, students with reading difficulties and students learning English as a second language. It is a perfect complement to any phonics program and is fully customisable. We are confident it will quickly become a favourite tool for teachers, parents, reading difficulty specialists and anybody else with an interest in the teaching of reading and spelling! 


Features


- Created by a speech-language pathologist specialising in reading development
- Scientifically-based
- Easy to use
- Fun, intuitive and powerful teaching tool
- Perfect for children learning to read English, including students with learning difficulties and students of English as a second language (ESL)
- Patent-pending, adjustable memory-aid system helps students remember letter-sound patterns
- Create and save custom activities to complement any synthetic phonics approach

title: Letter Sounds 1 Pro
description:
Letter Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro is a fun, effective and scientifically based phonics teaching tool which makes it easy to teach children the links between the letters of the alphabet and the speech sounds they typically represent in written English.   Letter Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro is based on research into reading acquisition and was developed by reading specialist and speech-language pathologist Dr. Bartek Rajkowski, PhD. Anybody with an interest in teaching children to read through phonics can use Letter Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro to help children learn common letter-sound relationships!


Letter Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro is based on our flagship program, ReadingSounds¬Æ 1 Pro, which is used in over 1000 Australian schools and is being described by educators as a breakthrough in teaching children how to read.


PLEASE NOTE:
- This app is Australian! US and UK accent options will be added in the next update!
- Although children love using it, Letter Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro is not just a game - it is a powerful and fully customisable teaching tool. Please take some time to experiment with it yourself before trying it with students!


Why is letter-sound knowledge so important?


The past several decades of research have provided conclusive evidence that children who are strong readers are skilled in using letter-sound knowledge to learn new words when reading. Skilled readers are good at understanding that words are made up of speech sounds (a skill called phonemic awareness) and they are also good at understanding how these speech sounds are represented by letters. This knowledge helps children to ‚Äòdecode‚Äô written language and teach themselves new words. Difficulties with these skills are hallmarks of the struggling reader. Furthermore, teaching methods that begin by teaching students letter-sound relationships (called ‚Äòsynthetic phonics‚Äô methods) have been shown through research to be more effective than other approaches in teaching reading, regardless of whether students do or do not have reading difficulties. The evidence is clear: letter-sound knowledge is crucial in learning to read and spell since it helps students to teach themselves new words.


How does Letter Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro help?


Understanding that letters typically represent certain speech sounds poses a challenge to beginning readers since there is no meaningful relationship between the way that letters look and the speech sounds they typically represent. For example, there is no reason why the squiggle ‚Äús‚Äù represents the sound /s/ as in ‚Äúsun‚Äù. Children must also learn to distinguish between similar letters and sounds (e.g. ‚Äúb‚Äù vs ‚Äúd‚Äù) when learning letter-sound patterns.


Letter Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro uses a patent pending, self-adjusting, multisensory teaching method to help teach beginning and struggling readers to rapidly, automatically and accurately recognise and discriminate between the most common letter-sound patterns in English. Children are taught meaningful associations between the way that letters look and the speech sounds they typically represent through a unique system of visual, auditory and articulatory (speech sound) memory aids, or mnemonics. The teaching system in the app automatically identifies what a child knows, what the child does not know, and which letter-sound patterns the child confuses. Letter Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro teaches children to discriminate between confusing patterns, and strengthens weaknesses in letter-sound understanding.


Who should use Letter Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro?


Letter Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro is ideal for helping beginning readers, students with reading difficulties and students learning English as a second language. It is a perfect complement to any phonics program and is fully customisable, making it easy to set up custom activities to teach students specific letter-sound patterns. We are confident it will quickly become a favourite tool for teachers, parents, reading specialists and anybody else with an interest in the teaching of reading and spelling!

title: Sight Words 1 Pro
description:
Sight Words 1 Pro is a must-have app for anybody teaching students to read and spell! The app makes it easy to teach students who are learning to read and spell to automatically recognise and understand the 200 most common words in English.


Sight Words 1 Pro uses a unique, patent pending, self-adjusting and multisensory teaching method to improve word recognition and vocabulary knowledge. It was developed by Dr. Bartek Rajkowski, PhD, a speech-language pathologist specialising in reading development.


PLEASE NOTE:
- Although students love using it, Sight Words 1 Pro is not just a game - it is a powerful and fully customisable teaching tool. Please take some time to experiment with it yourself before trying it with students!


The past several decades of research have provided conclusive evidence that competent readers are skilled in using letter-sound knowledge to work out (decode) unfamiliar words when reading. Teaching methods that begin by teaching students letter-sound relationships (synthetic phonics methods) are known to be superior to other approaches in teaching reading, regardless of whether students do or do not have reading difficulties. Decoding skills are crucial for self-teaching, as they may be used to work out regular words (words with regular sound-spelling patterns, such as ‚Äòstop‚Äô and ‚Äòflight‚Äô) however they are not as useful for learning the approximately 20% of English words with irregular spellings (words such as ‚Äòwho‚Äô and ‚Äòsaid‚Äô).


Research suggests that in addition to being taught to decode, students should be explicitly taught to recognise the most common words (also called 'sight words' or 'high frequency words'), especially those with irregular spellings. Learning to instantly recognise highly frequent words helps students to develop fluency in reading. 


Whether you are a teacher, parent or reading specialist, we are confident that Sight Words 1 Pro will quickly become a favourite teaching tool. For more information about the program, please see www.readingdoctor.com.au.


Some of the things you can do with SightWords 1 Pro:

- Teach sight words through arcade-style games in which you choose words for the student to practice based on categories such as

        - Word length (such as all word lengths, 1-2 letter words, 3 letter words, 4 letter words)
        - Word frequency (such as 1st 25 most common words, 2nd 25 most common words etc)

- Easily create custom sight-words activities where you can quickly set up activities by choosing from a library of the 200 most common words in English

- Save custom activities for later use

- Choose the number of words to be included in a single game (2-25)

- Adjust the number of times students need to correctly identify a word in order for the game tile to be completed

- Adjust the level of support given to the student for words (the app includes auditory word prompts, auditory sentences, illustrations of the meanings of words and visual cues based on word length and shape)


Please note: teaching students sight words before they have learnt basic decoding skills is NOT recommended, and not supported by research! Teaching sight words should be a complementary strategy to assist the development of fluency as part of a systematic, phonics based method of reading instruction.


If you have any questions or need help, please don't hesitate to contact us!

title: Reading Therapy
description:
1800+ phrase & sentence level reading comprehension tasks with the option of creating your own exercises! 

**Try for FREE with Language Therapy Lite** 

This app gives adults with neurological impairment (stroke, brain injury, aphasia) the practice they need in between reading words and reading stories. It's a digital workbook of semantically organized reading comprehension tasks with the added ability for you to create your own exercises in each mode! 

Goal Areas: Reading Comprehension, Attention, Problem Solving, Visual Processing, Reasoning 
Can be used with: Aphasia, Alexia, Alzheimer's Disease, Dementia, Cognitive-Communication Impairment, Brain Injury, Language Learning Disability, Autism, English as a Second Language Learners 

Features: 
*4 modes with over 450 exercises each, for 1,800+ reading comprehension practice items
1)Phrase Matching 
2)Sentence Matching 
3)Phrase Completion 
4)Sentence Completion 

*Hundreds of clear full-color photographs selected by a Speech-Language Pathologist used in both matching modes 
*Carefully-crafted foils on each exercise challenge users to read carefully 
*Clean interface with symbol support allows for independent use 
*Automated scoring allows for easy data-tracking 
*Wrong answers are grayed out once selected 
*Forward and back buttons allow users to skip items and go back to discuss completed items or retry skipped exercises 
*Users see their answers paired with the stimulus for reinforcement of the correct answer 
*Turn any picture/word on or off 
*Limit answer choices to 2, 3, or 4 
*Results can be e-mailed in report-ready format so clients can keep their therapist informed of their progress and therapists can send results to themselves for charting later, using the copy-and-paste ready format to decrease documentation time 

Looking for something different in a speech therapy app? We offer a wide range to choose from. Get the right one for you at https://tactustherapy.com/find

title: Dyscalculia Screener Checklist
description: Dyscalculia is an inborn learning disability that affects the capability to do basic math. Although many schools have specialists that handle other learning disabilities, Dyscalculia is still very unknown and people can have difficulty with math throughout their school career and later life without ever finding out what the cause was. This application gives you a quick tool to find out if you could have signs of Dyscalculia and provides some resources to get more information and support.

title: Learning Disability Nursing
description:
This Wiley - Blackwell app-book,Learning Disability Nursing at a Glance, is developed by MedHand Mobile Libraries. Improve your performance with relevant, valid material which is accessed quickly and with minimal effort in the palm of your hand using Medhands patented technology.

Functions include: 

‚Ä¢	A powerful search 
‚Ä¢	Bookmarks, History and Highlighting  
‚Ä¢	Complete set of medical calculators; Body Mass Index, Peak Expiratory Flows, Dehydration Correction Calculator and more 
‚Ä¢	Notes and picture notes

Learning Disability Nursing at a Glance is the perfect companion for study and revision from the publishers of the market-leading at a Glance series. This visual, dynamic and user-friendly resource addresses the key principles underpinning contemporary learning disability nursing practice, relates them to key clinical practice issues, and explores them in the context of maintaining health and well-being. 

Exploring the full spectrum of care, this textbook addresses the needs of people with learning disabilities across the life span, from children through to adolescents and on to adults and older people. Aimed at nursing, health and social care students, as well as registered nurses, this is an invaluable resource for all those looking to consolidate and expand their knowledge, in order to provide safe, effective and compassionate care to people with learning disabilities.

‚Ä¢	The perfect revision and consolidation textbook
‚Ä¢	Highly visual colour presentation, with full colour illustrations throughout
‚Ä¢	Includes expert contributions from learning disability academic staff as well as clinicians
‚Ä¢	Embraces both primary and secondary care perspectives
‚Ä¢	Supported by a companion website featuring case studies to further test your knowledge
‚Ä¢	Available in a range of digital formats- perfect for ‚Äòon the go‚Äô study and revision

title: Spelling Sounds 1 Pro
description:
WHAT IS SPELLING SOUNDS‚Ñ¢ 1 PRO? 

Spelling Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro helps beginning and struggling readers to learn to spell. It is a fun, effective and scientifically based teaching tool that helps you to teach students to segment (break up) words into speech sounds and to then spell them using letter-sound knowledge. The app uses a unique teaching system that automatically identifies what a child knows, what the child does not know, and which words the student finds difficult.

Spelling Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro includes a large library of CVC, CCVC and CVCC words (such as "cat, spot" and "lost") and is fully customisable, making it easy to set up custom activities to teach students to read specific word types (such as words ending in -at, or words beginning with st-). While the app is designed to be able to be used independently, it is a perfect complement to our flagship program, Reading Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro.


WHY IS THE ABILITY TO BREAK WORDS UP INTO SPEECH SOUNDS WHEN SPELLING IMPORTANT?

Skilled spellers are good at understanding that words are made up of speech sounds (a skill called phonemic awareness). They are also good at understanding how these speech sounds are represented by letters in words. These skills help children to spell words successfully because understanding how letters usually represent the way we say words gives children an advantage in understanding our spelling system. Difficulties with these skills are a hallmark of the struggling speller.


HOW DOES SPELLING SOUNDS‚Ñ¢ 1 PRO HELP?

Spelling Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro uses a patent pending, self-adjusting, multisensory teaching method to help teach beginning and struggling spellers to use letter-sound knowledge to spell simple words with direct letter-sound patterns, such as "cat, stop" and "lost". The teaching system automatically identifies what a child knows, what the child does not know, and which words the child confuses. Spelling Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro includes a large library of CVC, CCVC and CVCC words. It is fully customisable, making it easy to set up custom activities to teach students to spell specific word types (such as words ending in -at, or words beginning with st-). 


WHO SHOULD USE SPELLING SOUNDS‚Ñ¢ 1 PRO?

Spelling Sounds‚Ñ¢ 1 Pro is ideal for helping beginning spellers, students with spelling difficulties and students learning English as a second language. It is a perfect complement to any phonics program and is fully customisable. We are confident it will quickly become a favourite tool for teachers, parents, literacy specialists and anybody else with an interest in the teaching of reading and spelling! 


SUMMARY OF FEATURES

- Created by a literacy expert
- Scientifically-based
- Easy to use
- Fun, intuitive and powerful teaching tool
- Perfect for children of all ages learning to read English, including students with learning difficulties and students of - English as a second language (ESL)
- Patent-pending, adjustable memory-aid system helps students remember letter-sound patterns
- Create and save custom activities to complement any synthetic phonics program
